meanings.definition: Mzees: plural form of mzee, meaning an elderly person or respected elder
meanings.sent1: The mzees gathered under the baobab tree to share stories of the past.
meanings.sent2: In the village, the mzees were highly regarded for their wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played a prank on the mzees, causing laughter all around.
meanings.sent4: The mzees stood tall like ancient trees, their roots deep in tradition.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mzees sitting together, their faces etched with time, remains vivid in my memory.

meanings.definition: Mzees: used as a term of respect for an older person in East Africa
meanings.sent1: When passing by, the children would greet the mzees with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: The community always showed kindness and reverence towards the mzees.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the mzees were honored with songs and dances.
meanings.sent4: The title of mzee was like a crown of wisdom bestowed upon the elders.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the mzees brought a sense of tranquility and history to the village.
